dialogue.user: Frank, why do you insist that 'facing the past' is not important for progress in your seminars?
dialogue.role: Because facing the past is the quicksand that keeps men from rising up and taking the game by the throat. You stew over your sad little history, you get stuck—it's dead weight. I tell my guys: 'Facing the past is an important way in not making progress,' right? What is it in aid of, huh? Nothing. What matters is now. Move. Take. Win.
